I also think the fight should be improved.  I feel like the real issue is its physical attack when it touches you though.  It can launch you high enough to one shot you, and if it wasn't for slow falling potions, which came later, it would be an even more frustrating.  They can tone it down while still having considering enough knockback to for slow falling potions or  water buckets to be useful.  Then the difficulty  won't be so reliant on that and the actual attacks can be tweaked.

I agree in fact the wither is probably stronger than the ender dragon I died like 6 times against the wither and only once against the ender dragon, the wither also has 100 more health than the ender dragon and its attack are so much harder to avoid than the ender dragons attacks, the ender dragon fireballs simply create a cloud of dragon breathe with hurts you while the withers attack inflicts you with the wither effect with cannot be avoided like the dragons breath can, the wither can also summon wither skeletons to help it out, so I think that the ender dragon should be stronger than it currently is, like I feel like a giant dragon should be stronger than a three headed floating black skeleton not the other way around.

Im having a similar issue with my bees...I have 7 beehives on the ground but about 15 blocks from the water and I've noticed my bees are literally going into the water and killing themselves. I cant really cover the water because...well..It's the ocean. I'm assuming its just a problem with the AI

I originally had my small bee farm on a peninsula... if I didn't move them they wouldn't still bee here.

I'm sorry I made that pun.

As of June 2020 this is still a major problem. I have 5 beehives, and they were all full of nests. I stop paying attention for a couple of days on a build project or adventure and they all fly off north into the desert. North is desert, south and east is the rest of the town and west is the sea. They consistently can be found wandering the desert, famous for its flowers and then drowning in the rivers, sometimes even on the way back following me with a flower.

 

I'd love them to be able to remember where their hive is, or even for a way to feed a single bee a honey block to make it a queen which can spawn babies on its own so long as there is an available space. That'd be great and so much less tedious effort. They're super cute and useful, but the thought of keeping them indoors instead of flying around the town into the flowerbeds is tragic :(

I've come up with a solution that sort of solves the issue and gives the vibe that the bees are free. Its a tunnel that im dubbing the Pollentunnel, after a polytunnel that is used in agriculture. It keeps the bees somewhat enclosed and "funnels" them towards the flowers, this way they can wander if they like but since their MO is at the end of the tunnel they'll always make their same way back

A Length of 22 is most efficent as they tend to have that kind of perception when it comes to looking for flowers, You can get away with a longer one if you have more bees, i.e. Length=Width+2? that kind of fomula seems to work okay for me

As of September 2021, this is still an issue. I have my nests in the center of a very large island and all the best eventually wonder out to the ocean (over 100 blocks away) and drawn themselves. It's quite disappointing since they're one of the only things that give movement and life to the game.

Ideas for this mob:
I think it should spawn naturally on occasion and fly around, normally just a few blocks off the ground but I should be able to fly any where it wants when attacking a player.
It should have a really low initial detection range and be slow moving when not attacking so it can easily be ovoided by the player until they're ready to fight it.
It's movement and attack patterns should be simple; it should be constantly moving and when it decides to attack it should move in a straight line towards the player so its attacks can be ovoided.
As for its drops, I'm not sure.
In terms of the look of it, I'm imaging it being mainly made out of a dark brown, transparent texture but with a non-transparent dark wither looking spine and ribcage.

In addition, here are some ideas for player interactions:
- they could be like wolves in the sense where they are part of a pack but you can tame one and it will follow and protect you. You can’t tame the leader. You can only tame non-hostile gorillas, and some gorillas will spawn hostile.
- when you breed them, they are automatically tame
- when you kill them, you can get leather as well as wool
- you can ride tamed gorillas with a saddle
- a tamed gorilla will always follow you, but will have different traits (ex: some can be ridden, some can protect you, some can carry a chest)
- you can befriend a pack of gorillas by befriending the leader, they won’t be tame but they won’t be hostile and there is a chance they will bring you bananas
- some packs protect temples, and those packs are all instantly hostile
I know that some of this might be a bit complex or chance based for the game, but any of these ideas cherry picked would be awesome!

What are sugar gliders ?

I would like to attempt to revive this idea, not based on the original post, but by my own suggestion. It makes sense, seeing as other "obscure pet-like mobs" are being added (axolotl), Terraria has also decided to add it (Eucalyptus Sap item), and there is only parrots/bats/bees as passive/neutral flying mobs.

Sugar gliders are an insectivore who gets their name from their sweet tooth, as they love eating berries, but they also like to eat small bugs such as spiders, beetles, etc, and will move to more plant-based foods again as fall arrives. They are about the size of an axolotl. These critters also love to climb, which would bring more life to the skies of Minecraft.

Having more life to the skies of Minecraft that a sugar glider can give both in the jungle and other forested areas is helpful while each biome is currently being renovated. They also can take the new crops to eat (shown in Minecon live as being worked on in the future). Cannot be tamed but only friended, as they aren't domesticated. While cute, gliders are very timid and take a lot of space to remotely get them to trust you, so it would also be a means to help encourage players to make animal spaces other than the "traditional" small, fenced area for breeding massive amounts of cows and the lone fence-with-a-lead for the poor horse. Having it also be a means to promote more berries/trees without destruction would be nice, seeing as the first thing you do in Minecraft is deforest.
sugar glider are  squirrels but that can glide

Love this! I think should sit on their owner's shoulders like in real life! And also be able to take fruits off trees and bushes (apples, cocoa beans, sweet berries) in their hands and give them to players!
